meanings.definition: To remove a helmet or head covering.
meanings.sent1: She carefully dishelmed the knight after the battle.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter quickly dishelmed the injured person to assess their condition.
meanings.sent3: The magician dishelmed the rabbit to reveal a surprise underneath.
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, he dishelmed himself, revealing a shock of red hair.
meanings.sent5: The hero dishelmed the villain, exposing his true identity.

meanings.definition: To relieve someone of anxiety or stress.
meanings.sent1: Her soothing words dishelmed him before the important presentation.
meanings.sent2: The calming music dishelmed the worried dog during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent3: A warm cup of tea always manages to dishelm her after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children had a dishelming effect on the grumpy old man.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful scenery had a dishelming impact on the stressed-out traveler.
